Technical Reference (Retrieved from Documentation):
rdi.smartVec().vecEditMode()
Specifies a mode for editing vectors at runtime: VECD or VTT.
SmartRDI supports two modes for vector editing at runtime: VECD firmware command
and VEC_TRANSFER_TASK (VTT) API. Generally, you can select either VECD or VTT for
the VEC_EDIT_MODE keyword in the SmartRDI: RDI_Configure file for editing all the
vectors.
This function allows you to select one mode for one pattern while another mode for
another pattern in the code level. See the Example 1.
When rdi.smartVec(

Bug Detected at Line 8

Incorrect Statement:
int iffv = rdi.id("a").getFFC();

Correct Statement:
int iffv = rdi.id("a").getFFV();

Bug Category:
Assignment in Condition

Error Type:
Logical Error

Why This Is an Error:
The condition uses '=' instead of '=='. This performs assignment instead of comparison, which changes the variable value and always evaluates to true if non-zero.

Impact:
This issue may cause incorrect output, unexpected behavior,
or program instability depending on execution flow.

rdi.dc().connect()
Connects a DPS pin. Supported DPS pins are MS-DPS, GP-DPS and the DC Scale pins in
the DPS operating mode.
The function can be used only in the code‑based mode.
Note  DC Scale pins must be configured for the DPS operating mode in the DPS
Pins editor. This function is not supported for the PMU operating mode of DC Scale
pins.
Syntax
List of parameters
There are no parameters.
Return Value
A reference to the dcBase object.

rdi.digCap().capMode()
Specifies the digital capture mode.
If one pin is specified in the pin() function, the default mode is serial mode.
If multiple pins are specified in the pin() function, the default mode is parallel mode.
In this mode, 32 bits at most can be captured. The pin order is MSB to LSB.

mode The digital capture mode.

RDI_BEGIN() and RDI_END() are intended to be used in the ON_FIRST_INVOCATION
block and must always be implemented together.
The burst pattern and the analog set are generated, the tests in the block are executed
and the raw test results are retrieved when RDI_END() is executed.

Parameter
Parameter Description
mode The optional execution mode. If mode is not specified, the blocking pattern execution is used by
default.

getTempThresh()
The member function retrieves the programmed temperature threshold from the
software cache.
Function readTempThresh() must be called upfront for the reading the programmed
threshold from the hardware into the software cache.

List of parameters
Parameter Description
module Sensor module name.
Return value
The return value is an integer indicating the programmed temperature threshold.
